text: every Friday small-scale uprisings break
out in the West Bank teenage
Palestinians sling rocks at Israeli
soldiers the army fires tear gas
grenades and rubber bullets it started
as an isolated act of civil disobedience
protesting an Israeli security barrier
now it's a weekly grassroots movement
across five Palestinian towns with the
peace process stalled and little hope of
a solution the protests are a desperate
effort to end Israel's military
occupation and to rebrand the
Palestinian image as peaceful
demonstrators and not suicide bombers
bossom Tamimi a Palestinian whose family
has been living in the tiny village of
nabi saleh for generations is organizing
the protests for the sixth straight week
we shall to the world to see what's the
satellite on the settlement and the
occupation do for libel esteem it's our
voice he is enraged that for the past
six months Palestinians have been
prevented from accessing their farmland
by settlers under the protection of the
Israeli army on this Friday morning the
Israeli soldiers have taken a position
right behind mr. Tamizh home which has
become an unofficial headquarters for
international activists who support
their cause on Friday January 22nd
Israeli soldiers arrested mr. Tamim ease
wife nerimon she was released in a day
and warned never to attend another
protest but she vowed to defy these
orders just before the next
demonstration neriman prepares food for
some unlikely allies I see myself as
joining their struggle and I think we're
all helping each other in building a
different future here Israeli Jonathan
Paula a part-time graphic designer from
Tel Aviv attends the protest nearly
every Friday has been arrested
numerous times and claims to have
suffered brain hemorrhages from tear gas
cartridges he's recently become an
official spokesman for the Palestinians
I don't believe that the world is
divided that way to their people and my
people I'm here because I opposed the
occupation because I oppose what
happening here and the people who fight
their occupation are my people while the
skirmishes have ideological roots
sometimes they feel more like a
spectacle this young man is hit by a
rubber bullet in the kidney area better
father he appears to go unconscious but
would recover completely protests to
begin with theatrical precision each
Friday afternoon prayers both sides take
their positions in front of the press
which have a front row seat of the
action the media landscape is as much a
battlefield as the borders are but on
some Fridays the show takes a serious
turn this footage is from a pro
palestinian-israeli activist filmed in
the Palestinian village of Beale in the
first place to adopt these weekly
protests twenty-five-year-old billion
resident bossom Abulafia seen here
wearing a fluorescent yellow shirt was a
regular protester on April seventeenth
2009 mr. Abu Rahman was standing on the
Palestinian side when he was suddenly
shot in the chest
with a high-velocity rubber coated
aluminum tear gas canister yeah
something odd I'm gonna he died before
reaching the hospital according to
Palestinian sources 19 demonstrators
have been killed since 2004 while no
Israeli soldiers have been killed
according to the Israeli army hundreds
of servicemen have been wounded captain
Barack roz would not discuss a barajas
death is there not peaceful protests not
people singing we shall overcome these
are very violent very dangerous and very
very illegal methods when the situation
escalates we have no no choice but to
use other right dispersal means the sole
job shooting whoa boom booms rubber
bullets and it's it's a small thing the
rather the rocks throwing stones it is
unclear whether the Palestinians are
gaining support or changing their image
through these protests what is clear is
that the Israeli army takes them very
seriously that can not be so after
midnight demonstrations have been
increasingly violent and more protest
leaders are being arrested
mr. to mimi's wife Mary man is arrested
for the 2nd friday in a row along with
five other palestinian-israeli Jonathan
Paula is also arrested but he's released
an hour later on the way home he writes
a press release detailing his version of
the day's events in late January nerimon
Tamimi is still incarcerated with the
army no longer behind his house mr.
Tamimi goes for a stroll to explain to
his young boys about their mothers
detention for the New York Times this is
jaron Galinski in Navi Saleh West Bank
